meanings.definition: The thick, rounded posterior end of the corpus callosum in the brain.
meanings.sent1: The splenium helps connect the two sides of the brain.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study the splenium to understand brain functions better.
meanings.sent3: The splenium decided to take a break from all the brain work.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts traveled through her mind like a train passing through the splenium.
meanings.sent5: The splenium is like a bridge between the left and right brain.

meanings.definition: A rounded or elongated structure at the back of an organ or body part.
meanings.sent1: The splenium of the kidney filters waste from the blood.
meanings.sent2: She felt a sharp pain in her splenium after the fall.
meanings.sent3: The splenium of the guitar was damaged, affecting its sound.
meanings.sent4: His voice echoed in the room, bouncing off the walls like a sound wave hitting the splenium.
meanings.sent5: The splenium of the spine provides support and protection for the nerves.
